suppressedMessages.message: Unexpected any. Specify a different type.

suggestions.desc: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.
Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.

suppressedMessages.message:
Error: Cannot access refs during render

React refs are values that are not needed for rendering. Refs should only be accessed outside of render, such as in event handlers or effects. Accessing a ref value (the `current` property) during render can cause your component not to update as expected (https://react.dev/reference/react/useRef).

C:\Users\johr9\Documents\git\wedding-invitation\src\lib\performance-optimizations.ts:9:7
   7 |   const ref = useRef(dependency);
   8 |
>  9 |   if (ref.current !== dependency) { // eslint-disable-line react-hooks/refs
     |       ^^^^^^^^^^^ Cannot access ref value during render
  10 |     ref.current = dependency; // eslint-disable-line react-hooks/refs
  11 |   }
  12 |

Error: Cannot access refs during render

React refs are values that are not needed for rendering. Refs should only be accessed outside of render, such as in event handlers or effects. Accessing a ref value (the `current` property) during render can cause your component not to update as expected (https://react.dev/reference/react/useRef).

C:\Users\johr9\Documents\git\wedding-invitation\src\lib\performance-optimizations.ts:10:5
   8 |
   9 |   if (ref.current !== dependency) { // eslint-disable-line react-hooks/refs
> 10 |     ref.current = dependency; // eslint-disable-line react-hooks/refs
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^ Cannot update ref during render
  11 |   }
  12 |
  13 |   return ref.current; // eslint-disable-line react-hooks/refs
